odors.name: banana
odors.hedonic_valence: pleasant; high liking that diminishes with satiety
odors.long_description: Sweet, ripe-fruit, creamy; strongly pleasant food odour. Psychophysical work finds high liking that only drops under satiety.

odors.name: mandarin_orange
odors.long_description: Fresh, juicy, citrus-sweet; “uplifting” and almost uniformly pleasant.

odors.name: pear
odors.long_description: Green, watery-sweet, oily-fruity; gentle pleasantness, often used to soften blends.

odors.name: apple
odors.long_description: Crisp, green-sweet, slightly waxy; reliably pleasant and “fresh.”

odors.name: mango
odors.long_description: Tropical, resinous-sweet with green minty nuance; rated highly pleasant in tropical-fruit panels.

odors.name: peach
odors.long_description: Creamy, ripe-peach, buttery; very pleasant, gourmand.

odors.name: strawberry
odors.long_description: Intense candy-like, caramel-jammy; evokes strong positive hedonic responses.

odors.name: cloves
odors.hedonic_valence: mildly pleasant at low dose; harsh if concentrated
odors.long_description: Warm, spicy, phenolic; mildly pleasant at low dose, but medicinal/clove-oil harshness can lower ratings when concentrated.

odors.name: coriander
odors.long_description: Sweet-floral, citrus-herbal; generally perceived as fresh-pleasant, though dislike rises in people sensitive to “soapy” coriander.

odors.name: cumin
odors.hedonic_valence: pleasant in trace culinary doses; often unpleasant neat
odors.long_description: Intense, spicy-green, slightly animalic; pleasant in culinary traces but often rated unpleasant or pungent neat.

odors.name: garlic
odors.hedonic_valence: typically unpleasant as pure vapour; appetitive in culinary context
odors.long_description: Pungent, alliaceous, metallic; typically hedonically negative as a pure vapour yet appetitive when linked to cooked-food context.

odors.name: almond
odors.hedonic_valence: polarising—pleasant in desserts, sharp if concentrated
odors.long_description: Sharp, sweet-bitter almond/cherry; polarising—pleasant in desserts and perfumery, unpleasant if overly sharp.
